app module

class app.MainApplication[source]

Bases: Tk

This is a class to handle the functionality of the interface

__init__()[source]

Constructor method

Parameters:

  • filePath (str) – path to the file to be read or written

  • funcParams (tk.StringVar()) – parameters of the function to be fitted

  • numResComps – number of components of the result

  • fileName (tk.StringVar()) – name of the file to be read or written

  • modelEquation (tk.StringVar()) – equation of the function to be fitted

browseFiles()[source]

opens filedialog for user to specify the location of the file and sets file name and file path if the user did not cancel the dialog

computeParameters()[source]

calculates the desired parameters based on the requirements provided by the user

openResultsWindow(parameters)[source]

returns a ResultWindow object to present the resulting fitted parameters

Parameters:

parameters (list[float]) – the calculated parameters

validateEntry(P: str)[source]

validation method to ensure only digits are entered for #FunctionParameters and #ResultComponents

Parameters:

P (str) – character that user tries to enter

Returns:

true, if entered character is a digit or empty (e.g. backspace), false otherwise

Return type:

bool

class app.ResultsWindow(mainWindow, message)[source]

Bases: Toplevel

This is a class to handle the functionality of the interface in connection with the presentation of the results

__init__(mainWindow, message)[source]

Constructor method

Parameters:

  • mainWindow (MainApplication class object) – the underlying main interface window

  • message (list) – final equation with the calculated fitted parameters

download()[source]

opens filedialog for user to specify the location for the file with the results to be written if the user did not cancel the dialog

This function combines the functionality to write the results into a file and save it on the computer

restart()[source]

sets the program to it’s default state
